description: Kishwar Chowdhury, a Bangladeshi from Melbourne, Australia is set to appear on the newest season of MasterChef Australia.In conversation with the Huffington post, Kishwar revealed she comes from “a big family of cooks”, and is proud of using recipes from her loved ones to make her own versions of them in the kitchen.“The Bengali cuisine that I carry with me has been passed down from generation to generation. I’ve always taken a little creative licence with it,” she says.

recipes.cooking_method: In a pan, cook onion, garlic, and ginger until softened. Add beef and cook until browned. Add curry powder and salt, stir to coat. Add water and simmer for 30-40 minutes. Serve with rice.
In a pan, cook onion, garlic, and ginger until softened. Add fish and cook until tender. Add coconut milk, curry powder, and salt, stir to combine. Simmer for 10-15 minutes. Serve with rice.
In a pan, cook onion, garlic, and ginger until softened. Add vegetables and cook until tender. Add curry powder and salt, stir to coat. Add water and simmer for 10-15 minutes. Serve with rice.

description: Fatima Begum is a Bangladeshi chef who is known for her ability to create delicious and healthy dishes. She is passionate about using fresh, locally sourced ingredients and is known for her use of herbs and spices to add flavor to her dishes. She has worked in some of the best restaurants in Bangladesh and is widely regarded as one of the best chefs in the country.

recipes.cooking_method: Cook rice according to package instructions. In a separate pan, cook onion, garlic, and ginger until softened. Add chicken and cook until browned. Add biryani spice mix and salt, stir to coat. Layer rice and chicken mixture in a pot. Cover and simmer for 20-30 minutes. Serve hot.

In a pot, cook onion, garlic, and ginger until softened. Add lentils and enough water to cover. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to simmer. Cook for 20-25 minutes or until lentils are tender. In a separate pan, heat ghee and add cumin seeds. Cook until fragrant. Add the cooked lentils to the pan and stir to combine. Add salt to taste. Serve hot with rice or naan.
In a pan, cook onion, garlic, and ginger until softened. Add fish and cook until tender. Add coconut milk, curry powder, and salt, stir to combine. Simmer for 10-15 minutes. Serve with rice.

description: Kamal Ahmed is a Bangladeshi chef who has worked in some of the best restaurants in Bangladesh and the United States. He is passionate about creating new and innovative dishes that showcase the best of Bangladeshi cuisine. He is known for his use of traditional ingredients and his ability to create dishes that are both authentic and modern.

recipes.cooking_method: In a pan, cook onion, garlic, and ginger until softened. Add shrimp and cook until pink. Add coconut milk, curry powder, and salt, stir to combine. Simmer for 10-15 minutes. Serve with rice.

In a pot, cook onion, garlic, and ginger until softened. Add chicken and cook until browned. Add yogurt and spices, stir to combine. Simmer for 20-25 minutes or until chicken is tender. Serve hot with rice or naan.

In a pan, heat poppy seeds until fragrant. Grind into a fine paste. In a separate pan, cook onion until softened. Add potatoes, turmeric, and salt. Stir to coat. Add water and simmer until potatoes are tender. Add poppy seed paste and green chilies, stir to combine. Simmer for 5-10 minutes. Serve hot with rice.

description: Atika Rahman is a Bangladeshi chef who is known for her use of fresh and flavorful ingredients. She is passionate about creating dishes that are both delicious and healthy and is widely regarded as one of the best chefs in Bangladesh. She has won numerous awards for her cooking and is known for her ability to create dishes that are both simple and elegant.

recipes.cooking_method: In a pan, cook onion, garlic, and ginger until softened. Add fish and cook until tender. In a separate bowl, mix mustard paste with a little water to form a paste. Add the paste, green chilies, turmeric, and salt to the pan. Simmer for 10-15 minutes. Serve hot with rice.
In a pot, cook onion, garlic, and ginger until softened. Add chickpeas and cook until tender. Add diced tomatoes and spices, stir to combine. Simmer for 10-15 minutes. Serve hot with rice or naan.

In a pan, cook onion, garlic, and ginger until softened. Add potatoes and cauliflower, stir to coat. Add turmeric, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt, stir to combine. Add water and simmer until vegetables are tender. Serve hot with rice or naan.

description: Sadia Islam is a Bangladeshi chef who is passionate about creating dishes that are both delicious and beautiful. She is known for her attention to detail and her ability to create dishes that are visually stunning. She has worked in some of the best restaurants in Bangladesh and is widely regarded as one of the most talented chefs in the country.

recipes.cooking_method: In a pan, cook onion, garlic, and ginger until softened. Add lamb and cook until browned. Add curry powder and salt, stir to coat. Add water and simmer for 30-40 minutes. Serve with rice.

In a pan, cook onion, garlic, and ginger until softened. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Add green chilies, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt, stir to combine. Simmer for 5-10 minutes. Serve hot with rice.

In a pot, cook onion, garlic, and ginger until softened. Add chicken and cook until browned. Add yogurt and spices, stir to combine. Simmer for 20-25 minutes or until chicken is tender. Serve hot with rice or naan.

description: Abdur Rahman is a Bangladeshi chef who is passionate about creating dishes that are both delicious and unique. He has worked in some of special event and some bridal event management as one of the most talented chefs in the country.

recipes.cooking_method: In a pan, cook onion and green chilies until softened. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric, and salt, stir to combine. Add boiled and mashed potatoes, stir to coat. In a separate bowl, mix flour with water and oil to form a dough. Roll out the dough into circles and fill with the potato mixture. Deep fry until golden brown. Serve hot with chutney.

Marinate fish fillets in lemon juice, turmeric, chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt for at least 30 minutes. In a pan, heat oil and fry the fish until golden brown. Serve hot with rice and salad.

Wash rice and lentils and soak for 30 minutes. In a pot, cook onion, garlic, and ginger until softened. Add soaked rice and lentils, stir to coat. Add water, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric, and salt, stir to combine. Simmer until rice and lentils are cooked. In a separate pan, heat ghee and fry the green chilies until fragrant. Add to the pot and stir to combine. Serve hot with achar and papad.
